PEER2025 Program Local Information Contributors

PEER2024 Program

The 3rd Workshop on Processing and Evaluation Event Representations (PEER2024) was held at Cornell University on March 29, 2024. Both talks and breaks were on the top floor of the Johnson Art Museum.

  • 08:30–09:30
    Breakfast

  • 09:30–9:40
    Opening Remarks

  • 09:40–10:40
    Expectation-based Semantics in Language Comprehension

    Noortje Venhuizen (Tilburg University)

  • 10:40–11:00
    Coffee Break

  • 11:00–11:20
    Generating event descriptions with syntactic and semantic constraints

    Angela Cao (University of Rochester)

  • 11:20–11:40
    Situating phonological phenomena within events

    John Starr (Cornell University)

  • 11:40–12:00
    Reasoning about propositional attitude reports in Bayesian dynamic semantics

    Julian Grove (University of Rochester)

  • 12:00–13:00
    Lunch

  • 13:00–13:20
    Are Triggers All You Need for Document-Level Event Extraction?

    Shaden Shaar (Cornell University)

  • 13:20–13:40
    Causality in Hate Speech

    Kaelyn Lamp (Cornell University)

  • 13:40–14:00
    Event-Keyed Summarization

    William Gantt (University of Rochester)

  • 14:00–14:20
    Coffee Break

  • 14:20–14:40
    FAMuS: Frames Across Multiple Sources

    Alexander Martin (University of Rochester)

  • 14:40–15:00
    Probing Representations for Document-level Event Extraction

    Barry Wang (Cornell University)

  • 15:00–15:20
    Enhancing Language Model Representations with Attributed Network Embeddings

    Jacob Matthews (Cornell University)

  • 15:20–15:40
    Coffee Break

  • 15:40–16:40
    Events and objects in mind and language

    Anna Papafragou (University of Pennsylvania)

  • 16:40–17:00
    Closing Remarks
